title: Blue Cheese Burgers Recipe
description: These blue cheese burgers are a real treat for burger fans. Turn plain patties into the best burgers ever with pungent blue cheese and a bit of hot sauce.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Burger Recipes Blue Cheese Burgers 4.6 (974) 675 Reviews 57 Photos Blue cheese burgers aren't just basic hamburgers — they're a real treat, and the wise cook will make up a dozen or so for the freezer. If you like blue cheese, you'll never forget these burgers. Submitted by QUIKSMYLE Updated on January 13, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 57 57 57 57 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 2 hrs Total Time: 2 hrs 25 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 12 burgers Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 3 pounds lean ground beef ½ cup minced fresh chives 4 ounces blue cheese, crumbled 1 ½ teaspoons salt 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce 1 teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper 1 teaspoon dry mustard ¼ teaspoon hot pepper sauce 12 hamburger buns, split Directions Mix ground beef, chives, blue cheese, salt, Worcestershire sauce, pepper, mustard, and hot pepper sauce together in a large bowl until well combined. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. When ready to cook, preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate. Remove beef mixture from the refrigerator; form into 12 patties. Cook patties on the preheated grill until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads at least 160 degrees F (71 degrees C), about 5 minutes per side. Serve on hamburger buns. Add Your Photo Photos of Blue Cheese Burgers 01 of 57 Photo by  Allrecipes Magazine 02 of 57 Photo by  PlumUdo4887 05/31/2023 Take a look at my version:>Squair burger and bun>Fresh mushrooms and red onion on the bottom>Red and yellow bell peppers on top>Honey mustard dressing on top 03 of 57 Photo by  SmartKelp9205 08/28/2022 Made it their way..I have had it many time when I lived in Chicago.Used Sams had ground ribeye $2.99 a lbs ..only on sale...had small Hogie rolls..did in iron pan..onions..pickieled peppers..or ..what I had ..served with Katchup..and most importantly .. More blue on top.Awesome to those who really love this stuff...You got to race...whats in the fridge/freezer. 04 of 57 Photo by  king dad 09/13/2018 This is awesome! After reading the reviews, I did decide to double the bleu cheese and I am glad that I did. Very good recipe. 05 of 57 Photo by  Chef Mo 06/27/2018 I was hoping for stronger flavors. Definitely not a bad burger. Maybe next time I will add more blue cheese and see if that makes the burger "pop" more with the flavors. 06 of 57 Photo by  Kudzoo 06/15/2018 07 of 57 Photo by  Casablancaise 10/08/2017 I made as written, except for using 80/20 ground beef. I use lean ground beef for casseroles, meatloaf.. But not for burgers. You need that fat for a juicy burger. We liked these burgers, but we felt they didn't have enough blue cheese. We had to top them with extra blue cheese, at the table. 08 of 57 Photo by  Katrina Rellen Cebrian 01/04/2016 09 of 57 Photo by  Allrecipes Magazine 08/06/2015 10 of 57 Photo by  Nanby 07/06/2015 Several years ago, I had my first blue cheese burger at a big-timber restaurant in Seattle, Wa. Being very hungry that day, I decided upon this type burger and was hooked by its' lusicious flavors. This is a wonderful recipe and brought me back there. I added crisp bacon on top. Was a perfect burger to celebrate the 4th with.
